definition: to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time

sentences.english: The impression of the splendour of Tianya, reality into the brink.
sentences.chinese: 印象中的蝶舞天涯，現實中成了懸崖勒馬。

sentences.english: We need consumers who will hold their feet to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要懸崖勒馬的用戶。

sentences.english: Rapidly, Zhou Yu managed to rein back, but he was shot in the left rib and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜急勒馬回時，被一弩箭，正射中左肋，翻身落馬。

sentences.english: Stopped the horse, Pingzhi Lin jumped down and walked in the eatery.
sentences.chinese: 一勒馬，飄身躍下馬背，緩步走向酒肆。

sentences.english: In gratitude, he soon afterwards bought a piece of property at Burgh-le-Marsh.
sentences.chinese: 出於感激，不久他就在伯勒馬什買了一塊地產。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
